title: Stanford career experts explain the 5 things that will get your resume in front of top hiring managers
text:
Before you get to show off your firm handshake or warm smile at interviews, it's your resume that will catch the eye of hiring recruiters. However, you won't advance to interview rounds if your resume isn't top notch upon submission.

BEAM, the career education hub at Stanford University, is comprised of career experts who work with students to bridge students' education, ambition, and meaningful work — and help them find the job of their dreams.

Here are five things these Stanford career experts say every resume needs to get you your next job.
description: Formatting should showcase the experience you want employers to notice, and you should pack descriptions with action verbs.
